com.hms_networks.americas.sc.localdatafiles

Class LocalDataFileManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • com.hms_networks.americas.sc.localdatafiles.LocalDataFileManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class LocalDataFileManager
extends java.lang.Thread
    Class that manages the naming and storage of local data files containing reports of processed data points and alarms.
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    HMS Networks, MU Americas Solution Center

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.lang.Thread

        java.lang.Thread.State, java.lang.Thread.UncaughtExceptionHandler

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private boolean doProcessing
      Boolean flag that controls the loop in the local data file manager thread.
      private long fileWriteIntervalMillis
      The interval at which the local data file buffer is written to the appropriate file on disk by the local data file functionality.
      private long lastDeleteOutdatedFilesTimeMillis
      Timestamp for the last time a call to deleteOutdatedFiles() was made.
      private java.lang.String localDataFileRootFolder
      Root folder where the local data file management folder structure and files are created and stored.
      private java.lang.StringBuffer localDataFileWriteBuffer
      String buffer which is used for output that is written to local data files during loops in run().
      private int retainNumberMonths
      The number of months to retain local data files before deletion.

      • Fields inherited from class java.lang.Thread

        MAX_PRIORITY, MIN_PRIORITY, NORM_PRIORITY

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LocalDataFileManager(java.lang.String localDataFileRootFolder, int retainNumberMonths, long fileWriteIntervalMillis)
      Instantiates a local data file management class with the specified local data file root folder and number of months to retain files.

    • Field Detail

      • localDataFileRootFolder

        private final java.lang.String localDataFileRootFolder
        Root folder where the local data file management folder structure and files are created and stored.

      • retainNumberMonths

        private final int retainNumberMonths
        The number of months to retain local data files before deletion.

      • fileWriteIntervalMillis

        private final long fileWriteIntervalMillis
        The interval at which the local data file buffer is written to the appropriate file on disk by the local data file functionality.

      • doProcessing

        private boolean doProcessing
        Boolean flag that controls the loop in the local data file manager thread.

      • localDataFileWriteBuffer

        private java.lang.StringBuffer localDataFileWriteBuffer
        String buffer which is used for output that is written to local data files during loops in run().

      • lastDeleteOutdatedFilesTimeMillis

        private long lastDeleteOutdatedFilesTimeMillis
        Timestamp for the last time a call to deleteOutdatedFiles() was made. The initial value is 0 to force a call to deleteOutdatedFiles() at each connector startup.

    • Constructor Detail

      • LocalDataFileManager

        public LocalDataFileManager(java.lang.String localDataFileRootFolder,
                            int retainNumberMonths,
                            long fileWriteIntervalMillis)
        Instantiates a local data file management class with the specified local data file root folder and number of months to retain files. NOTE: This class requires the local time offset provided by LocalTimeOffsetCalculator to provide accurate timestamps. You must call LocalTimeOffsetCalculator.calculateLocalTimeOffsetMilliseconds() prior to instantiating this class.
        Parameters:
        localDataFileRootFolder - folder where local data file structure will be created/stored
        retainNumberMonths - number of months of local data files to retain prior to deletion
        fileWriteIntervalMillis - interval which the local data file buffer is written to the filesystem

    • Method Detail

      • getCurrentDataFilePath

        private java.lang.String getCurrentDataFilePath()
        Gets the file path of the data file for the current time.
        Returns:
        data file path

      • stopLocalDataFileManagement

        public void stopLocalDataFileManagement()
                                 throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Stops local data file management and returns when the local data file management thread has terminated.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if unable to wait for local data file management thread to terminates

      • deleteOutdatedFiles

        private void deleteOutdatedFiles()
        Deletes outdated local data files from the file system. The configured value of retainNumberMonths is subtracted from the current month to get the first month which will be deleted.

      • getDataFileHeader

        private java.lang.String getDataFileHeader()
        Gets the file header for local data files.
        Returns:
        local data file header

      • addAllDataPoints

        public void addAllDataPoints(java.util.List dataPoints,
                             boolean overwrite)
        Appends each data point in the specified list to the buffer which is written to local data file storage every fileWriteIntervalMillis milliseconds.
        Parameters:
        dataPoints - list of data points to add to local data file
        overwrite - boolean indicating if an existing data point (oldest) should be overwritten with each of the specified data points

      • addDataPoint

        public void addDataPoint(com.hms_networks.americas.sc.datapoint.DataPoint dataPoint,
                         boolean overwrite)
        Appends the specified data point to the buffer which is written to local data file storage every fileWriteIntervalMillis milliseconds.
        Parameters:
        dataPoint - data point to add to local data file
        overwrite - boolean indicating if an existing data point (oldest) should be overwritten with the specified data point

      • addAlarm

        public void addAlarm(int tagID,
                     java.lang.String tagName,
                     java.lang.String tagValue,
                     java.lang.String alarmType,
                     java.lang.String alarmStatus,
                     java.lang.String utcTimestamp,
                     java.lang.String localTimestamp)
        Appends the specified alarm point to the buffer which is written to local data file storage every fileWriteIntervalMillis milliseconds.
        Parameters:
        tagID - alarmed tag ID
        tagName - alarmed tag name
        tagValue - alarmed tag value
        alarmType - alarm type
        alarmStatus - alarm status
        utcTimestamp - alarm timestamp (UTC)
        localTimestamp - alarm timestamp (local time)

        Gets a string representation of the specified tag type.
        Parameters:
        tagType - tag type object
        Returns:
        tag type string
